description: Starting from a historic village the route is in easy going Lincolnshire's rolling countryside.
title: Castle Bytham

description: A circular route exploring the Upper Bure valley and passing through Blickling Park.
title: Blickling Hall
startFrom: Car park at the west end of Blickling Park near Oulton Lodge.
terrain: Fields and estate tracks; muddy if wet.

title: Annual General Meeting
description: The Annual General Meeting of the Club will take place on Tuesday 7th April 2020 at the Botolph Arms, Oundle Road, Peterborough starting at 7: 30pm. This is an important event in the running of the Club and we hope you will make every effort to attend.
AGENDA

1. Apologies for absence
  2. Minutes of AGM 2019
  3. Matters arising
  4. Chairman’s report
  5. Treasurer’s Report
  6. Election of Officers
  7. Any Other Business
Copies of the minutes of last year's meeting will be circulated prior to the meeting.
If you wish to submit a motion for discussion at the AGM, then please write it down together with the names of the proposer and seconder and hand it to one of the committee.
The following posts are up for re–election:

• Chairman
  • Secretary
  • Treasurer
  • PR Representative
  • Transport Co–ordinator
  • Route Planner
  • Special Events Co–ordinator
  • Editor
  • Membership Secretary
After the formal business which should take about half an hour, we usually stay on for a chat and a drink
If you are interested in taking on a role on the committee, then please talk to one of the committee. The success of the club relies on an active membership.

title: Easter in the Lake District
description: We have booked 10 beds at the YHA Eskdale which is set in 15 acres of private grounds; the hostel is on the doorstep of the highest and most challenging Lakeland peaks. The hostel is licensed and has a self-catering kitchen.

We will travel up on Friday leaving at approx. 8am and travel back Monday afternoon. The cost will be £120.75 (see booking form for options) which covers accommodation on Friday, Saturday and Sunday and breakfast on Saturday, Sunday and Monday. Packed lunches are available for an extra £5.95 each. We will probably have evening meals at the Woolpack Inn which is about 500m down the road, but there is also the option of a two–course meal in the hostel for £9.95. If you wish to self–cater the cost will be £102. Mileage costs will be in the order of £35. Non–members are subject to an additional payment of £3.
You need to send a completed booking form (to be found in the Newsletter) to Alan by Sunday 22nd March to book your place.
Places may be limited. First come first served. If you don’t fancy the Youth Hostel why not look into booking your own accommodation locally – but book early.

title: Club Night
description: Come along for a drink, to chat and discuss any Club business. All welcome.

title: Beer by Foot
description: This is not the Beer by–Rail, which is later in July, but this is a walk around some of the hostelries in Peterborough.

title: Beer by Rail
description: This event involves taking a train to Oakham for lunch and drinks at a couple of pubs (usually including the Grainstore brewery) and then returning by train to Stamford for more drinks in some of Stamford’s many hostelries. The train is then taken to return to Peterborough where what happens depends on how people feel. Usually we have an evening meal either in Stamford of back in Peterborough depending on people’s preferences. A good day if you like beer and social chit chat. There’s also some walking between the pubs.
Meet at Peterborough station about 11:30 in time to buy a ticket and get on the train. The proposed programme (which might change on a whim) is:

11:52Train Peterborough to Oakham
12:21Arrive Oakham to eat and drink but not necessarily in that order.
16:44Train Oakham to Stamford
16:59Arrive Stamford for more drinks at one or two pubs.
21:00Train Stamford to Peterborough
21:15Arrive Peterborough for a meal (if we haven't eaten in Stamford) and a final drink in the Brewery Tap(if it's still open) or the Draper's Arms if you're still up for it.
If you live in Stamford you can meet up with us either on the Oakham train or when we get back to Stamford.
Please contact Alan to let him know you are coming.
